intro: Paratropia serrata, commonly known as the serrated paratropia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white to pink petals and yellow stamens. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have serrated edges, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
